revised_title: A Description of a Pyramidal Celestial Phenomenon Observed in Upminster, Essex
tldr: The author, Reverend Mr. William Derham, describes a unique pyramidal appearance in the sky observed near Upminster, Essex. The phenomenon was visible for about a quarter of an hour after sunset and was similar in shape to the Aurora Borealis, though with a different color. Derham suggests that the atmosphere's disposition, including haze and vapors, might have caused the phenomenon.
